latestAction.text: Referred to the Committee on Armed Services, and in addition to the Committee on Intelligence (Permanent Select), for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

Referred to the Committee on Armed Services, and in addition to the Committee on Intelligence (Permanent Select), for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

bill.title: To direct the Secretary of Defense to carry out a program to protect United States students against foreign agents.
bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 163, Number 110 (Tuesday, June 27, 2017)]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Ms. SHEA-PORTER:H.R. 3066.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:ARTICLE I, SECTION 8.[Page H5232]

item.latestTitle: National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2018

item.title: To direct the Secretary of Defense to carry out a program to protect United States students against foreign agents.
To direct the Secretary of Defense to carry out a program to protect United States students against foreign agents.

item.name: Introduced in House
item.text: This bill requires the Department of Defense to develop and implement a program to prepare U.S. students studying abroad to recognize and protect themselves against recruitment efforts by foreign intelligence agents.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
